newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong gold ends firmer on Europe shortcovering.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong gold ends firmer on Europe shortcovering.

text.p: Gold ended the Hong Kong trading session up on New York's close on continued fund short-covering, dealers and traders said on Wednesday.
Morning trade saw some profit-taking from Japanese traders at the Tokyo Commodity Exchange (TOCOM), pushing the price down to $383.20/383.70 at around 12.30 pm (0430 GMT).
Gold prices jumped on European short-covering during afternoon trade, gold sources said.
"I don't think they have finished short-covering yet," said Anderson Cheung, chief bullion trader at Swiss Bank Corp.
Interbank professionals marked up gold prices, looking for more follow-through buying on fund shortcovering, traders said.
Gold traders saw resistence at around $385.50.
Bullion ended at US$384.10/364.60 an ounce on Wednesday against New York's US$383.90/384.40 close on Tuesday.
Local gold ended HK$14 higher at HK$3,538 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society dropped to -5.00 on Wednesday from its previous fix at -3.00.
